api_call:
curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key?email=SOME_STRING_VALUE&phone=SOME_STRING_VALUE&code=SOME_STRING_VALUE'
description:
Revoke an Authentiq ID using email & phone.

If called with `email` and `phone` only, a verification code 
will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key?email=SOME_STRING_VALUE&phone=SOME_STRING_VALUE&code=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key?email=SOME_STRING_VALUE&phone=SOME_STRING_VALUE&code=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Delete.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key?email=SOME_STRING_VALUE&phone=SOME_STRING_VALUE&code=SOME_STRING_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "DELETE",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

Endpoint: key_register
API: Authentiq API
instruction_candidates.back_trans_input:
You will be given a user query for which an endpoint is useful.
In addition, you will be given the endpoint's identifier, the endpoint's functionality, the endpoint's description, and the name of the API this endpoint belongs to.
Your job is to re-generate the endpoint's identifier, functionality, description, and API name based on the given user query input.

Below are some examples:

###Input:
I need to revoke an authentiq id using email & phone. Please help me with that.
###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: Revoke an Authentiq ID using email & phone.

If called with `email` and `phone` only, a verification code 
will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to register a new Authentiq ID using the provided sub and development token. Could you please guide me through the process using the key\_register endpoint from the Authentiq API?

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to register a new Authentiq ID using the sub and devtoken. Could you please provide an example of how to use the endpoint key\_register from the Authentiq API for this purpose?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

Description: Register a new ID `JWT(sub, devtoken)`

v5: `JWT(sub, pk, devtoken, ...)`

See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples

Endpoint: key_register
API: Authentiq API
instruction_candidates.back_trans_input:
You will be given a user query for which an endpoint is useful.
In addition, you will be given the endpoint's identifier, the endpoint's functionality, the endpoint's description, and the name of the API this endpoint belongs to.
Your job is to re-generate the endpoint's identifier, functionality, description, and API name based on the given user query input.

Below are some examples:

###Input:
I need to revoke an authentiq id using email & phone. Please help me with that.
###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: Revoke an Authentiq ID using email & phone.

If called with `email` and `phone` only, a verification code 
will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.

Endpoint: key_revoke_nosecret
API: Authentiq API

###Input:

Functionality:

If called with `email` and `phone` only, a verification code 
will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.

Endpoint: key_revoke_nosecret
API: Authentiq API

###Output:
Functionality: 
Description: this is a scope confirmation
Endpoint: sign_confirm
API: Authentiq API

api_call:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D?secret=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

require 'uri'

require 'openssl'

request = Net::HTTP::Delete.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("HEAD", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Head.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

a self-signed JWT

See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples

Endpoint: key_update
API: Authentiq API

api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com")

conn.request("POST", "/key/%7BPK%7D")

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))

package main

import (

	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

import http.client

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Put.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

best_instruction.candidate: To update an Authentiq ID, please use the key\_bind endpoint from the Authentiq API. For v4, create a JWT token with the "sub", "email", and "phone" fields. For v5, make a POST request with the issuer-signed email and phone scopes, followed by a PUT request to update the registration JWT with the "sub", "pk", and "devtoken" fields. (Refer to the JWT Examples provided in the link for more details.)

api_call:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/key/%7BPK%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "PUT",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/login?callback=SOME_STRING_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to send a sign-in request to Authentiq API. Here's how to use the endpoint push_login_request. (Refer to the JWT Examples in the provided link for more details.)

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/login?callback=SOME_STRING_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/login?callback=SOME_STRING_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to make a scope verification request using the Authentiq API. Could you please provide an example of how to use the endpoint sign_request?

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope?test=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
description:
scope verification request
See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to make a scope verification request using the Authentiq API. Could you please guide me on how to use the endpoint sign_request for this purpose? (Refer to the JWT Examples in the provided link for more context.)

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope?test=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
description:
scope verification request
See: https://github.com/skion/authentiq/wiki/JWT-Examples

will be sent by email. Do a second call adding `code` to 
complete the revocation.

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to make a request for scope verification using the Authentiq API. Could you please guide me on how to use the endpoint sign_request to accomplish this?

api_call:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope?test=SOME_INTEGER_VALUE",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("DELETE", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Delete.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

]);

}

best_instruction.candidate: I want to check the status or current content of a verification job using Authentiq API. Can you help me with that by showing me how to use the sign_retrieve endpoint?

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I want to check the status or current content of a verification job using Authentiq API. Can you tell me how to do that using the endpoint sign\_retrieve?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("HEAD", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

best_instruction.candidate: I want to check the status of a verification job. Could you please guide me on how to use the Authentiq API to do that? Specifically, I believe I need to use the endpoint sign_retrieve_head.

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Head.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
description: HEAD to get the status of a verification job

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "HEAD",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("PUT", url, nil)

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Put.new(url)

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://6-dot-authentiqio.appspot.com/scope/%7Bjob%7D",

  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "PUT",
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}
